page.title: 14Transport for Eglwysbach
page.content: Most of the children in our school have a bike. But many children have problems going up hills and also there is a lot of traffic. Two boys in our school have motor bikes and they ride them mostly in the fields. Many young people in our village have motor bikes to go shopping, for work and for pleasure. A motor bike is cheaper to buy and run than a car. People use cars for shopping, going to work, visiting friends and relatives and going on holiday. Every Tuesday there is a bus to Llanrwst for people to go to the market. There are buses going to Llandudno and Colwyn Bay every day except Sunday and the bus does not go to Colwyn Bay every day. The nearest railway station is Tal-y-cafn, a single track joining the main line at Llandudno Junction. Nearest airports are at Manchester and Liverpool.
